result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew R Truss was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Any remaining fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for New Berlin Police Department.  Bail applied to costs.  Any remaining costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant already attended the Victim Impact Panel.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew R Truss in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 
60 months Imprisonment (Credit - 63 days)
30 months of Initial Confinement
30 months of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Condition Time: 12 months Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence todays date, LAST 60 DAYS STAYED.  Defendant already in Huber as Huber bailiee status, defendant allowed to report back to huber on his own.  
FINE:  $3835.50 to be paid as a condition of probation, Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $250.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to New Berlin Police Department.
DL REVOCATION: 36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
Defendant already attended the Victim Impact Panel
AODA Assessment and follow through
Sentencing hearing at 02-10-2016 08:30 am
email sent to booking.

Court REVOKES bail, but will allow the defendant to be released for work release.  Defendant is taken into custody, to follow all conditions of huber, may not use or possess any illegal controlled substances. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. .

Defendant Matthew R Truss in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  Court orders a short form PSI be done.  Attorney Wolff moves for huber bailee status.  Court REVOKES bail, but will allow the defendant to be released for work release.  Defendant is taken into custody, to follow all conditions of huber, may not use or possess any illegal controlled substances. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
